activities.loc: Calumet County Courthouse, West Entrance, Room 121

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Preliminary Hearing requested - time limits waived
Bond amended

948.03(2)(b) - Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm
946.49(1)(a) - Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor

Shall not have contact with S.Y. (DOB 08/01/2020) or R.E.H. (DOB 03/04/2002).  No contact means no contact in person, in writing, by phone, computer, through a third person or otherwise, except through the defendant's attorney.
Shall not have contact with entire apartment complex located at 139 E. Mitchell Avenue, City of Appleton, WI.
Shall not have unsupervised contact with any juveniles. Supervisor shall be a parent or guardian. 
Shall maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs.
*Defendant may have one visit with officer to retrieve just basic belongings to get by while case is pending.
